text.p: Recall that [mathjaxinline]C[0,1][/mathjaxinline] is the vector space of continuous functions on the interval [mathjaxinline][0,1][/mathjaxinline], and that we have an inner product on that vector space given by [mathjaxinline]\langle f, g \rangle = \int _0^1 f(x)g(x) \ dx[/mathjaxinline].
Let [mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline] be the subspace of [mathjaxinline]C[0,1][/mathjaxinline] which is the span of a single function [mathjaxinline]f(x) = x[/mathjaxinline].
Let [mathjaxinline]g(x) = x^2[/mathjaxinline]. What is the orthogonal projection of [mathjaxinline]g[/mathjaxinline] onto [mathjaxinline]W[/mathjaxinline]?
